div.p:
—The opinion of
Baron Humboldt upon “moving tables” is
found in the Dresden Journal. According
to a communication in that paper, Hum-
boldt writes Dr. Franz Schlegel, M. D., of
Altenburgh, in relation to two treatises
upon “moving tables” by the Doctor.—
The letter, is as follows:

“It is easier to combat a theory than
facts imperfectly observed. There are
diseases of belief which return periodically,
and are as endemical with the polished as
with the lower classes, because in the
former they assume the form of dogma-
tism and arrogance peculiar to the super-
ficial. I tender you, most honored Doctor,
my kindest thanks for the publication of
your very simple mechanical explanation
of the turning of tables towards the north
pole. But you will convert nobody.

salute.hi:
With the highest esteem, &c.
ALEXANDER VON HUMBOLDT.
